newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - HK Newspaper headlines - July 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - HK Newspaper headlines - July 21.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Hong Kong press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

--EXPRESS NEWS -- Sources in Beijing said the upcoming 15th Communist Party congress would make a decision to replace the present system of state-owned enterprises with a share holding one. There were indications President Jiang Zemin would have more control over the economy after the congress.
-- MING PAO -- Guangdong province issued new regulations to discipline public security staff. Off-duty policemen were banned from carrying guns when going drinking or going to nightclubs.
-- WEN WEI PO -- China's strategic missile forces has been greatly improved. Most of their equipment has been upgraded to make them ready for modern-style battles.

-- ECONOMIC TIMES -- Sources said about 10 companies have applied to the Stock Exchange to seek listings before September, among which five were Chinese state-owned enterprises. Pan Zhi Hua Iron and Steel Group intended to raise HK$1.87 billion.
-- At least 32 new hotels would be built in Hong Kong in the next three to four years, which would provide 12,000 jobs.
-- SOUTH CHINA MORNING POST -- A labour bill suspended only last week by the Provisional Legislative Council would be scrapped without review.
-- China Strategic Holdings launched a rescue package for troubled Siu Fung Ceramics Holdings in a deal that would give it a majority stake in the debt-ridden company.

-- HONGKONG STANDARD -- A major breakthrough was expected in Sino-US relations as Beijing was about to offer compromises in its trade policies in an effort to solve its long-term disputes with Washington.
